p: As shown in Table 2, ethanol (IC 50 = 27.68 ± 0.31 μg/mL) exhibited strongest ABTs radical scavenging activity, followed by methanol (IC 50 = 34.41 ± 0.78 μg/mL), acetone (IC 50 = 64.35 ± 1.58 μg/mL), dichloromethane (IC 50 = 82.31 ± 2.15 μg/mL), ethyl acetate (IC 50 = 91.19 ± 0.88 μg/mL), chloroform (IC 50 = 93.70 ± 5.06 μg/mL), and n-hexane (IC 50 = 103.05 ± 2.41 μg/mL).
